### About this resource
In this webinar from the *Exploring Artificial Intelligence @ UW-Madison* series, Lori Kido Lopez (PhD), a professor at UW-Madison and author of [Race and Digital Media](https://www.wiley.com/en-us/Race+and+Digital+Media%3A+An+Introduction-p-9781509546923), explores the deeply embedded issue of racism within AI systems. She discusses how histories of institutionalized racism in big data, the tech industry, and society at large continue to shape AI development today. The talk emphasizes the structural biases embedded in AI technologies and their implications for marginalized communities, urging a critical, equity-centered engagement with artificial intelligence.
